result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andres E Gallardo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andres E Gallardo in court.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints May Lee as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney May Lee accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at NO RECOMPENSE.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
$500 signature bond is reinstated. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Andres E Gallardo in court. Student Intern Madeline Witte appeared under the supervision of prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Br. 15.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andres E Gallardo not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference. Defendant failing to appear.  On the State's motion, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
No use/possession of any firearms or dangerous weapons

Defendant Andres E Gallardo in court. Student Intern Kevin Clancy under the supervision of Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andres E Gallardo not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 9/20/2022.
  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Andres E Gallardo not in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-1-2022 @1:30p
